item.name: Amrou Scout
item.text: {4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: The people of Amrou were scattered by war and driven into hiding. Scouts maintain the beacon fires that signal "return" and "home."

item.name: Amrou Seekers
item.text: Amrou Seekers can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or white creatures.
item.flavorText: The paradise of Amrou Haven had become a field of cinders. Its people struggled to survive, hoping to see visions of its past in the strange storms that quickly passed.

item.name: Angel's Grace
item.text: Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.) You can't lose the game this turn and your opponents can't win the game this turn. Until end of turn, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.

item.name: Benalish Cavalry
item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
item.flavorText: "My people swore to protect Benalia to the end. It is battered, but yet stands, as do we."

item.name: Castle Raptors
item.text: Flying As long as Castle Raptors is untapped, it gets +0/+2.
item.flavorText: "Each place we see is as ruined and lifeless as the last. So here we stay, because this ruin is ours."

item.name: Cavalry Master
item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.) Other creatures you control with flanking have flanking. (Each instance of flanking triggers separately.)

item.name: Celestial Crusader
item.text: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.) Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.) Flying Other white creatures get +1/+1.

item.name: Children of Korlis
item.text: Sacrifice Children of Korlis: You gain life equal to the life you've lost this turn. (Damage causes loss of life.)
item.flavorText: "We have a proud history of self-sacrifice. But it is easy, in these bleak times, to find one among us who is eager to die for any cause." —Tavalus, acolyte of Korlis

item.name: Chronosavant
item.text: {1}{W}: Return Chronosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped. You skip your next turn.
item.flavorText: "In my dreams, I hear the voices of my future selves who have died in times yet to come. I use that knowledge to avoid those dark futures and continue my search for peace."

item.name: Cloudchaser Kestrel
item.text: Flying When Cloudchaser Kestrel enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment. {W}: Target permanent becomes white until end of turn.

item.name: D'Avenant Healer
item.text: {T}: D'Avenant Healer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature. {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
item.flavorText: "One arrow keenly fired might prevent more battlefield wounds than I could treat."

item.name: Detainment Spell
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature's activated abilities can't be activated. {1}{W}: Attach Detainment Spell to target creature.
item.flavorText: Bind the mind rather than the wrist, and you stop the intent to harm before it starts.

item.name: Divine Congregation
item.text: You gain 2 life for each creature target player controls. Suspend 5—{1}{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{W} and exile it with five time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

item.name: Duskrider Peregrine
item.text: Flying, protection from black Suspend 3—{1}{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{W} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

item.name: Errant Doomsayers
item.text: {T}: Tap target creature with toughness 2 or less.
item.flavorText: "Heed my words, traveler. Plagues, war, desolation . . . all mere hints of what is yet to come from Dominaria's vault of horrors."

item.name: Evangelize

item.text: Flying {3}{W}: Exile Flickering Spirit, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
item.flavorText: It disappears each time with the hope that it will not return to the same desolation it left behind.

item.text: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.) Defender Foriysian Interceptor can block an additional creature.
item.flavorText: A focal point for time rifts, Foriys contends simultaneously with foes both new and old.

item.name: Fortify
item.text: Choose one — Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn; or creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Where metal is tainted and wood is scarce, we are best armed by faith." —Tavalus, acolyte of Korlis

item.name: Gaze of Justice
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Gaze of Justice, tap three untapped white creatures you control. Exile target creature. Flashback {5}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost and any additional costs. Then exile it.)

item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying. When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, put a 2/2 white Griffin creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

Whenever Gustcloak Cavalier becomes blocked, you may untap Gustcloak Cavalier and remove it from combat.

item.name: Icatian Crier
item.text: {1}{W}, {T}, Discard a card: Put two 1/1 white Citizen creature tokens onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: A thousand years removed from her home, her news of war had lost its context, but not its relevance.

item.name: Ivory Giant
item.text: When Ivory Giant enters the battlefield, tap all nonwhite creatures. Suspend 5—{W} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {W} and exile it with five time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

item.name: Jedit's Dragoons

item.flavorText: After Efrava was destroyed, the cat warriors scattered across Dominaria. Those who followed Jedit's example were strong enough to survive the ravages of apocalypse.

item.name: Knight of the Holy Nimbus
item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.) If Knight of the Holy Nimbus would be destroyed, regenerate it. {2}: Knight of the Holy Nimbus can't be regenerated this turn. Only any opponent may activate this ability.

item.name: Magus of the Disk
item.text: Magus of the Disk enters the battlefield tapped. {1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.
item.flavorText: Studying the journals of the necromage Nevinyrral leaves disciples gripped with the urge to exercise his draconian judgment.

item.name: Mangara of Corondor
item.text: {T}: Exile Mangara of Corondor and target permanent.
item.flavorText: "I have been brought to this place and I cannot leave. I may be free of the amber, but I am still in prison."

item.name: Momentary Blink
item.text: Exile target creature you control, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control. Flashback {3}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

item.text: When an opponent casts a creature spell, if Opal Guardian is an enchantment, Opal Guardian becomes a 3/4 Gargoyle creature with flying and protection from red.
item.flavorText: It was a moment in time, cast in stone—a moment whose time had come again.

item.name: Outrider en-Kor
item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.) {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Outrider en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.

item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.) As Pentarch Paladin enters the battlefield, choose a color. {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target permanent of the chosen color.

item.name: Plated Pegasus
item.text: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.) Flying If a spell would deal damage to a creature or player, prevent 1 damage that spell would deal to that creature or player.

item.name: Pull from Eternity
item.text: Put target face-up exiled card into its owner's graveyard.
item.flavorText: It is best to conquer dragons before they hatch. —Femeref adage

item.name: Pulmonic Sliver
item.text: All Sliver creatures have flying. All Slivers have "If this permanent would be put into a graveyard, you may put it on top of its owner's library instead."
item.flavorText: Like a great bellows it hisses, and its kin, both living and dead, are lifted to safety.

item.name: Quilled Sliver
item.text: All Slivers have "{T}: This permanent deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature."
item.flavorText: "They have long kept us under attack, but we do not lack for ammunition. The very bodies of our foes arm us against them." —Adom Capashen, Benalish hero

Each player chooses a number of lands he or she controls equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players sacrifice creatures and discard cards the same way.

item.text: Exile target artifact or enchantment. If you cast this spell during your main phase, you may exile up to one other target artifact or enchantment.
item.flavorText: Some timelines forever fray, branch, and intermingle. Others end abruptly.

item.name: Serra Avenger
item.text: You can't cast Serra Avenger during your first, second, or third turns of the game. Flying, vigilance
item.flavorText: "Those who endure in the face of suffering, those whose faith shines long in evil days, they shall see salvation." —Song of All, canto 904

item.text: All Sliver creatures have flanking. (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks a Sliver, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
item.flavorText: "They encircled our patrol with the stealth of snakes, corralling us like livestock." —Merrik Aidar, Benalish patrol

item.text: First strike, protection from red When Tivadar of Thorn enters the battlefield, destroy target Goblin.
item.flavorText: His blade came down upon the neck of a goblin—but not the one he had charged. When Tivadar looked up, the world he had known was gone.

item.text: All Sliver creatures get +0/+2.
item.flavorText: "I have spied them, wandering and watching—but for what? I fear they watch for us." —Yonat of Amrou

item.flavorText: "Teferi snapped his fingers, and the viashino started clucking like a chicken. Silly, yes, but exactly the thing we needed to break the stifling tension." —Jhoira, master artificer

item.text: All Sliver creatures have shadow. (They can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

item.flavorText: "If it returns years hence, our knowledge of how to combat it will be that much greater." —Andorel, Tolarian sentinel

item.flavorText: To save this plane, he must forsake all others.

item.name: Telekinetic Sliver
item.text: All Slivers have "{T}: Tap target permanent."
item.flavorText: "Slivers are guided only by simple instinct. Advance the hive, and you will be welcomed. Impede the hive, and you will face unrelenting opposition." —Freyalise

item.text: Put target creature or land on top of its owner's library.

item.text: Hypergenesis is green. Suspend 3—{1}{G}{G} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay {1}{G}{G} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.) Starting with you, each player may put an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield. Repeat this process until no one puts a card onto the battlefield.

item.name: Krosan Grip
item.text: Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.) Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
item.flavorText: "Give up these unnatural weapons, these scrolls. Heart and mind and fist are enough." —Zyd, Kamahlite druid

item.name: Magus of the Candelabra
item.text: {X}, {T}: Untap X target lands.
item.flavorText: "What would Urza think, I wonder, if he could hear how the nature mages still snarl at his name, but venerate the work of his apprentice?" —Teferi, to Jhoira

item.name: Might of Old Krosa
item.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If you cast this spell during your main phase, that creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn instead.
item.flavorText: Sometimes even humble forest creatures were gifted with mighty emanations from the past.

item.name: Might Sliver
item.text: All Sliver creatures get +2/+2.
item.flavorText: "The colossal thing rumbled over the ridge, tree husks crumbling before it. The ones we were already fighting howled as it came, their muscles suddenly surging, and we knew it was time to flee." —Llanach, Skyshroud ranger

item.name: Molder
item.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. You gain X life.
item.flavorText: "The forests have succumbed to ruin, but the spirit of Krosa remains alive and vital in these devouring spores." —Zyd, Kamahlite druid

item.name: Mwonvuli Acid-Moss
item.text: Destroy target land. Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: "Life gives way to death, and death to new life. Nature feeds upon her own decay." —Ezrith, druid of the Dark Hours

item.name: Nantuko Shaman
item.text: When Nantuko Shaman enters the battlefield, if you control no tapped lands, draw a card. Suspend 1—{2}{G}{G} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {2}{G}{G} and exile it with a time counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

item.name: Pendelhaven Elder
item.text: {T}: Each 1/1 creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: The elder who carries the ancestral mantle of Jacques le Vert is tasked with his ancient mission: to protect the creatures of Pendelhaven.

item.name: Penumbra Spider
item.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.) When Penumbra Spider is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, put a 2/4 black Spider creature token with reach onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: When it snared a passing cockatrice, its own soul darkly doubled.

item.name: Phantom Wurm
item.text: Phantom Wurm enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it. If damage would be dealt to Phantom Wurm, prevent that damage. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Phantom Wurm.
item.flavorText: It died with the forest, yet both linger on in twisted form.

item.name: Primal Forcemage
item.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Their calls unheeded by the withered forests, nature shamans channeled the life force of their brethren.

item.name: Savage Thallid
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Savage Thallid. Remove three spore counters from Savage Thallid: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield. Sacrifice a Saproling: Regenerate target Fungus.

item.name: Scarwood Treefolk
item.text: Scarwood Treefolk enters the battlefield tapped.
item.flavorText: To treefolk's sense of time, ages pass as hours. They stood as witnesses to the apocalypse, the years of which they saw as one cacophonous, ultra-destructive moment.

item.name: Scryb Ranger
item.text: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.) Flying, protection from blue Return a Forest you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.

item.name: Search for Tomorrow
item.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library. Suspend 2—{G} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {G} and exile it with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.)

item.name: Spectral Force
item.text: Trample Whenever Spectral Force attacks, if defending player controls no black permanents, it doesn't untap during your next untap step.
item.flavorText: "The spirits of old have not left us unguarded." —Uros, Pendelhaven elder

item.name: Spike Tiller
item.text: Spike Tiller enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. {2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Tiller: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. {2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Tiller: Target land becomes a 2/2 creature that's still a land. Put a +1/+1 counter on it.

item.name: Spinneret Sliver
item.text: All Sliver creatures have reach. (They can block creatures with flying.)
item.flavorText: Each new generation of slivers evolves to assimilate the strengths of the prey upon which their progenitors fed.

item.name: Sporesower Thallid
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on each Fungus you control. Remove three spore counters from Sporesower Thallid: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

item.name: Sprout
item.text: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: Centuries of temporal strife had stripped Dominaria of its natural defenses, but nature fought back with armies constructed of little more than grime and sunlight.

item.name: Squall Line
item.text: Squall Line deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
item.flavorText: The constant shifting of Dominaria's shredded timeline played havoc with its atmosphere, combining savage electrical storms from ages past.

item.name: Stonewood Invocation
item.text: Split second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't cast spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.) Target creature gets +5/+5 and gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
item.flavorText: "Might of ancient wood and stone, Into spirit, flesh, and bone."

item.name: Strength in Numbers
item.text: Until end of turn, target creature gains trample and gets +X/+X, where X is the number of attacking creatures.
item.flavorText: "The hermit dies. The outcast dies. The lone wolf dies. Only those who stick together survive this world." —Uros, Pendelhaven elder

item.name: Thallid Germinator
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid Germinator. Remove three spore counters from Thallid Germinator: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield. Sacrifice a Saproling: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

item.name: Thallid Shell-Dweller
item.text: Defender At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid Shell-Dweller. Remove three spore counters from Thallid Shell-Dweller: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

item.name: Thelon of Havenwood
item.text: Each Fungus creature gets +1/+1 for each spore counter on it. {B}{G}, Exile a Fungus card from a graveyard: Put a spore counter on each Fungus on the battlefield.
item.flavorText: "The sight of my thallids still thriving is a bittersweet welcome to this cold waste."

item.name: Thelonite Hermit
item.text: Saproling creatures get +1/+1. Morph {3}{G}{G} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.) When Thelonite Hermit is turned face up, put four 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.

item.name: Thrill of the Hunt
item.text: Target creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn. Flashback {W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

item.name: Tromp the Domains
item.text: Domain — Until end of turn, creatures you control gain trample and get +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
item.flavorText: Ground into the footprints of the ravaging herd were clumps of salt from Benalia, moss from Llanowar, dust from Hurloon, and ash from as far as Urborg.

item.name: Unyaro Bees
item.text: Flying {G}: Unyaro Bees gets +1/+1 until end of turn. {3}{G}, Sacrifice Unyaro Bees: Unyaro Bees deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: With no jungle left to contain it, the "plague of daggers" spread across Dominaria.

item.name: Verdant Embrace
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has "At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield."

item.name: Wormwood Dryad
item.text: {G}: Wormwood Dryad gains forestwalk until end of turn and deals 1 damage to you. {B}: Wormwood Dryad gains swampwalk until end of turn and deals 1 damage to you.

item.name: Wurmcalling
item.text: Buyback {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.) Put an X/X green Wurm creature token onto the battlefield.

item.name: Yavimaya Dryad
item.text: Forestwalk When Yavimaya Dryad enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Forest card and put it onto the battlefield tapped under target player's control. If you do, shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: The parched earth still shielded those few souls with the heart to call it home.

item.name: Dementia Sliver
item.text: All Slivers have "{T}: Name a card. Target opponent reveals a card at random from his or her hand. If it's the named card, that player discards it. Activate this ability only during your turn."

item.name: Dralnu, Lich Lord
item.text: If damage would be dealt to Dralnu, sacrifice that many permanents instead. {T}: Target instant or sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost. (You may cast that card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

item.name: Firewake Sliver
item.text: All Sliver creatures have haste. All Slivers have "{1}, Sacrifice this permanent: Target Sliver creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn."
item.flavorText: "They are here, and they are hungry. And what they do not eat, they burn. Yavimaya is lost. We must leave now for Skyshroud." —Edahlis, greenseeker

item.name: Ghostflame Sliver
item.text: All Slivers are colorless.
item.flavorText: "This breed is on the cusp of evolution. It burns away the markings that connect it to a queen that no longer heeds its call. It seeks a new master. Perhaps I can give it one." —Freyalise

item.name: Harmonic Sliver
item.text: All Slivers have "When this permanent enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact or enchantment."
item.flavorText: "Since the last sliver arrived, even our mightiest relics splinter into shards as soon as we bring them against the hive." —Llanach, Skyshroud ranger

item.name: Ith, High Arcanist
item.text: Vigilance {T}: Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn. Suspend 4—{W}{U} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {W}{U} and exile it with four time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)

item.name: Kaervek the Merciless
item.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Kaervek the Merciless deals damage to target creature or player equal to that spell's converted mana cost.
item.flavorText: "Rats and jackals feast in his swath, but even they will not walk with him." —Mangara

item.name: Mishra, Artificer Prodigy
item.text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may search your graveyard, hand, and/or library for a card with the same name as that spell and put it onto the battlefield. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.
item.flavorText: A sojourn through time gave dark inspiration to one gifted young mind.

item.name: Opaline Sliver
item.text: All Slivers have "Whenever this permanent becomes the target of a spell an opponent controls, you may draw a card."
item.flavorText: "When struck, its hide shimmers through sequences of color—a signaling language I am eager to unravel." —Rukarumel, field journal

item.name: Saffi Eriksdotter
item.text: Sacrifice Saffi Eriksdotter: When target creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield this turn, return that card to the battlefield.
item.flavorText: In the blink of an eye, she strode from deep snow to dusty waste. From the crease of light behind her, a voice rang hollow: "Saffi, wait for me . . . ."

item.name: Scion of the Ur-Dragon
item.text: Flying {2}: Search your library for a Dragon permanent card and put it into your graveyard. If you do, Scion of the Ur-Dragon becomes a copy of that card until end of turn. Then shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: "I am the blood of the ur-dragon, coursing through all dragonkind."

item.name: Stonebrow, Krosan Hero
item.text: Trample Whenever a creature you control with trample attacks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Moments after a fickle rift dropped Stonebrow in the waste of his beloved Krosa, he took up his axe in rage-blind vengeance.

item.name: Assembly-Worker
item.text: {T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: With their factories long destroyed, some of Mishra's creations still toil in remote areas, endlessly performing and reperforming their last orders.

item.name: Brass Gnat
item.text: Flying Brass Gnat doesn't untap during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Gnat.
item.flavorText: Its buzzing is the sound of its inner mechanisms, ever winding down.

item.name: Candles of Leng
item.text: {4}, {T}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it has the same name as a card in your graveyard, put it into your graveyard. Otherwise, draw a card.
item.flavorText: "A tome stored in its light is as crisp as the day it was written." —Ettovard, Tolarian archivist

item.name: Chromatic Star
item.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Chromatic Star: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. When Chromatic Star is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
item.flavorText: "This item is not from . . . now. It reflects a sky no longer ours and gleams with hope that does not exist." —Tavalus, acolyte of Korlis

item.name: Chronatog Totem
item.text: {T}: Add {U} to your mana pool. {1}{U}: Chronatog Totem becomes a 1/2 blue Atog artifact creature until end of turn. {0}: Chronatog Totem gets +3/+3 until end of turn. You skip your next turn. Activate this ability only once each turn and only if Chronatog Totem is a creature.

item.name: Clockwork Hydra
item.text: Clockwork Hydra enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever Clockwork Hydra attacks or blocks, remove a +1/+1 counter from it. If you do, Clockwork Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature or player. {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Clockwork Hydra.

item.name: Foriysian Totem
item.text: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool. {4}{R}: Foriysian Totem becomes a 4/4 red Giant artifact creature with trample until end of turn. As long as Foriysian Totem is a creature, it can block an additional creature.

item.name: Gauntlet of Power
item.text: As Gauntlet of Power enters the battlefield, choose a color. Creatures of the chosen color get +1/+1. Whenever a basic land is tapped for mana of the chosen color, its controller adds one mana of that color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

item.name: Hivestone
item.text: Creatures you control are Slivers in addition to their other creature types.
item.flavorText: Rath's evincars used hivestones to control the slivers, but the overlay put their power into unwitting hands. Now the stones make not masters, but slaves.

item.name: Jhoira's Timebug
item.text: {T}: Choose target permanent you control or suspended card you own. If that permanent or card has a time counter on it, you may remove a time counter from it or put another time counter on it.

item.name: Locket of Yesterdays
item.text: Spells you cast cost {1} less to cast for each card with the same name as that spell in your graveyard.
item.flavorText: Every hour, at the turning of the glass, its owner had whispered to the locket, seeding it with secrets. This would be her legacy, her memory, if the rifts should take her.

item.name: Lotus Bloom
item.text: Suspend 3—{0} (Rather than cast this card from your hand, pay {0} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, cast it without paying its mana cost.) {T}, Sacrifice Lotus Bloom: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool.

item.name: Paradise Plume
item.text: As Paradise Plume enters the battlefield, choose a color. Whenever a player casts a spell of the chosen color, you may gain 1 life. {T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: A last wisp of paradise in a fallen world.

item.name: Phyrexian Totem
item.text: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. {2}{B}: Phyrexian Totem becomes a 5/5 black Horror artifact creature with trample until end of turn. Whenever Phyrexian Totem is dealt damage, if it's a creature, sacrifice that many permanents.

item.name: Prismatic Lens
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: It bends not light but mana, aligning its chaotic currents into the sharp angles necessary for the mystic's purposes.

item.name: Sarpadian Empires, Vol. VII
item.text: As Sarpadian Empires, Vol. VII enters the battlefield, choose white Citizen, blue Camarid, black Thrull, red Goblin, or green Saproling. {3}, {T}: Put a 1/1 creature token of the chosen color and type onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: The past still lives within its pages, waiting for its time to come again.

item.name: Stuffy Doll
item.text: As Stuffy Doll enters the battlefield, choose a player. Stuffy Doll is indestructible. Whenever Stuffy Doll is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to the chosen player. {T}: Stuffy Doll deals 1 damage to itself.

item.name: Thunder Totem
item.text: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool. {1}{W}{W}: Thunder Totem becomes a 2/2 white Spirit artifact creature with flying and first strike until end of turn.

item.name: Triskelavus
item.text: Flying Triskelavus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. {1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Triskelavus: Put a 1/1 colorless Triskelavite artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield. It has "Sacrifice this creature: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

item.name: Venser's Sliver
item.flavorText: Venser admired his handiwork and smiled. His first prototype had joined with the hive mind all too well, running with the brood and becoming a predator itself. This one, he thought, would be accepted into the hive but still obey his commands.

item.name: Weatherseed Totem
item.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. {2}{G}{G}{G}: Weatherseed Totem becomes a 5/3 green Treefolk artifact creature with trample until end of turn. When Weatherseed Totem is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, if it was a creature, return this card to its owner's hand.

item.name: Academy Ruins
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {1}{U}, {T}: Put target artifact card from your graveyard on top of your library.
item.flavorText: Its secrets once wrought the greatest artifice ever known. Now crabs loot the rubble to decorate their shells.

item.name: Calciform Pools
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Calciform Pools. {1}, Remove X storage counters from Calciform Pools: Add X mana in any combination of {W} and/or {U} to your mana pool.

item.name: Dreadship Reef
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Dreadship Reef. {1}, Remove X storage counters from Dreadship Reef: Add X mana in any combination of {U} and/or {B} to your mana pool.

item.name: Flagstones of Trokair
item.text: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool. When Flagstones of Trokair is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may search your library for a Plains card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: Dust-spiked winds eroded the stones, but the ground where they had stood still holds power.

item.name: Fungal Reaches
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Fungal Reaches. {1}, Remove X storage counters from Fungal Reaches: Add X mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G} to your mana pool.

item.name: Gemstone Caverns
item.text: If Gemstone Caverns is in your opening hand and you're not playing first, you may begin the game with Gemstone Caverns on the battlefield with a luck counter on it. If you do, exile a card from your hand. {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If Gemstone Caverns has a luck counter on it, instead add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

item.name: Kher Keep
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {1}{R}, {T}: Put a 0/1 red Kobold creature token named Kobolds of Kher Keep onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: "They're still here? The cockroach may have finally met its match." —Teferi

item.name: Molten Slagheap
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Molten Slagheap. {1}, Remove X storage counters from Molten Slagheap: Add X mana in any combination of {B} and/or {R} to your mana pool.

item.name: Saltcrusted Steppe
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Saltcrusted Steppe. {1}, Remove X storage counters from Saltcrusted Steppe: Add X mana in any combination of {G} and/or {W} to your mana pool.

item.name: Swarmyard
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {T}: Regenerate target Insect, Rat, Spider, or Squirrel.
item.flavorText: Where scavengers nest in hollowed-out rib cages and chittering crawlers peer from empty eye sockets, few dare to trespass.

item.name: Terramorphic Expanse
item.text: {T}, Sacrifice Terramorphic Expanse: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
item.flavorText: Take two steps north into the unsettled future, south into the unquiet past, east into the present day, or west into the great unknown.

item.name: Urza's Factory
item.text: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. {7}, {T}: Put a 2/2 colorless Assembly-Worker artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: "Though their ideals are leagues apart, Urza's and Mishra's creations have a surprising harmony with one another." —Tocasia, journal entry

item.name: Vesuva
item.text: You may have Vesuva enter the battlefield tapped as a copy of any land on the battlefield.
item.flavorText: It is everywhere you've ever been.
